website_summaries.verdict: A durable directional antenna that picks up an impressive number of channels in most locations.
pros: Lightweight, making it easier to mount outdoors
Picks up signals well over 45 miles
Signal is strong enough for 2- and 3-way splitter without preamp
cons: Weather can affect reception badly, regardless of tower distance
Advertised 80-mile range is a bit of a stretch for this antenna

customer_reviews.title: Bye, bye cable!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my parents. We originally started with an indoor antenna and the quality was choppy. Channels kept cutting in and out so we decided to order this outdoor antenna. The main selling point was that it comes with a pole for installation. The last thing I wanted to do was to order a separate item that wouldn't work. In terms of quality- no more choppiness or cutting in/out. Quality is just like cable and the best of all is that it is FREE!
customer_reviews.author: TamLe

customer_reviews.title: Mounting hardware inadequate.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good enough antenna but I haven't actually installed it yet. Only problem is the hardware. Loose hardware was in the box rattling around. One of the wing nuts provided was the wrong size and there were two missing washers. The support post mounting hardware was totally inadequate. Two very small lag bolts, you need four, were provided to mount the antenna support along with four small expansion bolts. The expansion bolts could only be used for masonry ??? Mounting bolts (4) need to be 1/4 inch with washers. There was also absolutely no paperwork about installation, suggested cable type or signal strength testers.
customer_reviews.author: fixit2002

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Very light and I like the old style design. I live in an area that often gets very high winds. I had one of the other style antennas before this which cost much more, didn't work any better and had much more surface area for the UHF part of the antenna and blew apart a few pieces at a time. This antenna is a real bargain at this price and even it it doesn't last, I could but 15 of them for the price of my previous antenna!
customer_reviews.author: Larry P

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful little but strong antenna.
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful antenna!! This little guy works great. I live almost 47 miles from the nearest tower. I have tried many others and didn't get anything. I was hoping to have good luck with this one.....and I did. I get about 24 channels and the reception is terrific. I have it on my roof and have a splitter in my attic to go to two rooms. Thank you ViewTV for a great antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy K

customer_reviews.title: great antenna
customer_reviews.text: decided to cut the cable. Had an old UHF antenna in the attic. Received 28 channels, I live 40 miles to Tampa. In the evening reception was marginal on some channels. Installed this antenna in attic. Reception was strong, morning and evenings, on 38 DTV and 29 TV Plus channels. Tried my TV amplifier on antenna. Received 48 DTV and 29 TV Plus channels.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Works great for and priced very well
customer_reviews.text: Works great for and priced very well. I can receive up to 30 channels, mostly HD, without a signal booster. We live in a smaller town southeast of Raleigh, NC and not extremely close to many towers. I installed the antenna in my attic to keep it out of the wind. During Hurricane Matthew, it came in very handy for viewing the news channels. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: DoubleTLS

customer_reviews.title: Everything you would want in an attic antenna
customer_reviews.text: Great Antenna. Easily assembled and mounted in attic. Gives great HDTV reception. I live in between two major east coast cities and this antenna pulls in all of the stations from the city it is pointed at. It also pulls in a few of the stations that are behind it in the other city. I would recommend this for anyone that needs a strong antenna to overcome the disadvantages of an attic mount.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne A

customer_reviews.title: Wow! What a difference!
customer_reviews.text: I had poor reception before I bought this antenna. But now the picture is crystal clear and the audio is perfect. I can hardly believe it! After I aimed the antenna at the signal source, my favorite on-air channels come in perfectly and I didn't have to pay for cable TV to get them. This antenna gets my fully enthusiastic recommendation! Try it!
customer_reviews.author: Mysterious Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Antenna!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother's bedroom TV set. We have a large antenna and splitter that works well for the other sets in the house. However, that bedroom wasn't wired to it. It was easier to put up another antenna rather than string wiring through a very tight crawl space. I, and more importantly, SHE is pleased. It was easy to assemble and install, and it picks up local OTA signals very well. Another plus was a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: G. M. MCNAIR

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and works  well
customer_reviews.text: I live much less than 80 miles from the TV transmitter antennas, but just far enough that basic indoor antennas cant get all the major networks that should be available. I mounted this in my loft and now get all of the networks with a really robust signal (it withstands going through a 3 way passive splitter and even the networks that had been a challenge to the other antennas are rock solid). I can't vouch for the 80 mile range, but I like this antenna. The build quality seems adequate and mounting with the included pole was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Rob T

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't write reviews for most items. I just had to with this little antenna. We had a huge name brand attached to the roof that pulled in 17 ota channels. Only problem, is I had to turn it to get NBC. I replaced with this 1/3 the size and pulled in 33 channels, NBC included. All in the same direction. This antenna is a great value at a low cost.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive And Works
customer_reviews.text: This would be the antenna I would recommend to someone wanting to try over the air tv. Inexpensive, light and pulls in a lot of stations. For weaker stations you will need a larger antenna.
customer_reviews.author: TuneRaider

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this antenna
customer_reviews.text: I live between Chicago and Milwaukee. 50 miles from Chicago and about 30 from Milwaukee. I placed the antenna towards Chicago. Got the direction from an app for my phone. I get 60 plus channels. My neighbor has a $300 setup on his garage and he gets 88 channels. For the price you can't beat it. Highly recommend this antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholi

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Tried an indoor antenna and didn't get ANY channels. Thought I would give this one a try. Seemed like a reasonable price for a trial. Wow! Got all the channels I was predicted to receive. Easy setup and install. Got it a day earlier than scheduled. Very pleased with this purchase. Clear HD picture on all local channels. Would recommend this antenna. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: chuckw

customer_reviews.title: Replace Satelite with OTA
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I love this guy! I used this to install an antennae where my Dish used to be. I needed nothing more. Remove your old "satelite dish" and just install this guy straight to the mounted pole and use their wires. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Pakmann2k

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Mounted 25 feet above ground, with a quarter mile of open field infront of it. I'm 56 miles from the transmitter locations with no terrain issues and I get none of those channels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still a good choice.
customer_reviews.text: It works, but does not pull in the distant stations as well as the similarly priced RCA antenna. Both mounted in the attic. I tried swapping them around and this one is just not as sensitive. Still a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Random Buyer.

customer_reviews.title: Great price and great antenna!
customer_reviews.text: This antenna was easy to mount and has great reception. I was skeptical of available channels and picture quality. But I get 134 channels and a lot in HD. I have this antenna feeding three TV's.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndon

customer_reviews.title: Wanted a good receiving antenna.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent performance! Receives from about 55-60 miles away. True, Iam using a 30 db preamplifier too. But for a small antenna it is impressing.
customer_reviews.author: namtsuy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Really pulls in stations. 24 miles away thru Texas Hill country.
customer_reviews.author: Runswithbeer

customer_reviews.title: reception is great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. It has great recepton without having to mount on roof. I mounted it on my privacy fence temporarly (might stay there) and still got clear pictures on the major stations. I tried a splitter for 3 televisions and to my surprise all were clear.
customer_reviews.author: CRD

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my flat indoor antenna with this one. Mounted in the attic of my 1 story house. Using a splitter, so I left my existing booster on. I went from 19 channels to 45 channels here in Sarasota, FL! Well worth the price. There might be better, but I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Keith S

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and no issues
customer_reviews.text: I've had this installed now for about 4 months and it has worked perfectly! Easy install and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Net Minder

customer_reviews.title: Worked better then an indoor antenna
customer_reviews.text: I live 20 miles from the TV towers so I was hoping to use an indoor antenna. Result, a lot of pixilation and poor signal quality. I finally installed the ViewTV DA-290 in the attic and I was surprised how much better the TV reception was.
customer_reviews.author: Dottie Reid

customer_reviews.title: ... I have it that the package I received looked like it had already been used awhile
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint I have it that the package I received looked like it had already been used awhile. Performance has been excellent. I get a boatload TV station. Of those, about 10 are worthwhile. Feels good to get rid of cable.
customer_reviews.author: L. Byrd

customer_reviews.title: a good antenna but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: the antenna was okay however it was missing two u bolts when it arrived but those were easily bought at a lowes, it picked up some channels but not the ones I was hoping to get but that maybe because of our locations, still a good antenna worth the buy, warning there is some assembly require and the instructions don't really describe how to put it together. but after ten minutes you can get it without them by just looking at the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bollinger

customer_reviews.title: Great reception coupled with a booster.
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money. Ran TV channel scan during the day and at night. The night time scan found more channels than the day time scan. With a little trial and error regarding antenna placement, you will be pleasantly surprised at the quality of the picture after you find the proper location..
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Nice antenna with mounting kit, great value. Installed at my father-in-law’s house and he was so thankful he can now get all the channels.
customer_reviews.author: J Yeung

customer_reviews.title: Works really well..
customer_reviews.text: It's big, but even with the line split to two TVs, I get great reception on all my local channels plus a few more. Anyway, I've bought others that were junk, but this ones sturdy and pulls in a good signal;-)
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: get 23 channels north Atlanta suburb attic installation 1 story house. ditch cable, save a lot
customer_reviews.author: Greystonedog

customer_reviews.title: Does the job in attic
customer_reviews.text: Very good antenna. Placed in attic and picks up 47 clear channels.
customer_reviews.author: doclv

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to assemble as long as you keep the directions.
customer_reviews.author: MckPatti

customer_reviews.title: Now I get more channels.
customer_reviews.text: Pulls in TV signals from 70 miles away. Easy assembly and of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Papawolf

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well and was easy to install. Included a pole for easy installation.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Cut the cable with this antenna
customer_reviews.text: So easy to set up. I cut the cord with cable provider weeks ago, and this antenna pulls in most of my favorite channels. I have it resting on top of a bush in my front yard. The reception is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dave W.

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: This antenna is as described and works well. It is compact and easy to install, I installed it on an existing post. Putting the antenna together and installing it it took me about 10-15 minutes. You can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: ART

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and works great. I have it installed in the attic and I'm getting 33 digital channels.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin E. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Works great and was easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This was sent to my grandparents in PR after the hurricane. They stated it works great
customer_reviews.author: kristal

customer_reviews.title: Works great even with mountains.
customer_reviews.text: I live about 30 miles from Pittsburgh and this antenna works better than I thought it would. I installed the antenna in the attic of my ranch home and I get all local channels and I can even get channels in Ohio if I point the antenna towards those stations.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Pugner

customer_reviews.title: Range is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Gave this antenna a shot for its low cost and were blown away by its range! This purchase was beyond well worth the money. Easy to install also!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great really helps to cut the cord with satellite tv. Great picture. Put in attic.
customer_reviews.author: doyle

customer_reviews.title: Great value on a good item!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this VeiwTV DA-290 is a GREAT DEAL. It arrives mostly assembled. I opted to also get the "included" mounting pole for an additional $10, which saved me several dollars over buying a pole from another seller. I've also ordered an amplifier to use with this antenna, but it will work fine until the amp arrives. I actually mounted this antenna to the ceiling of my rear deck and even though it's only 8 feet off ground level, it picks up all of the stations I was expecting and some I didn't expect.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Excellent reception with use in an attic!
customer_reviews.author: Cypress Pete

customer_reviews.title: 80 miles???
customer_reviews.text: Quality is fine/average there are no problems there. My ding is on the distance. I'm not sure how they are getting 80 miles out of this thing. I live North of Columbus, Ohio... Relatively flat. I can hit channel 34 who's transmitter is roughly 40 miles away, just fine with a signal strength in the 60's/70's. But Channels 4, 6, 10, or 28, or 53... who's transmitters are 50-60 miles away, NADA. So in the end I would recommend this for a suburban neighborhood, but definitely not 40+ miles away from their desired transmitter.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Williams

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not an 80 mile antenna
customer_reviews.text: I am 63 miles from the Philadelphia stations, I have it pointed at them but do not receive any of them. I am receiving other stations up to 27 miles away (from the rear of the antenna), but even with an amplifier connected I do not receive the ones that are 63 miles away. Also, this antenna was removed from the box and re-packaged before it was sent to me, and there were no instruction included with it...I put it together based on the pictures on the box. I will be looking for a replacement if I can't get it to tune into the stations that should be within range.
customer_reviews.author: dmndguy1

customer_reviews.title: This antenna was little bit better than the one I had previously
customer_reviews.text: This antenna was little bit better than the one I had previously. I got one more station,so I gave it three stars. I have it on a pole outside and the bad thing is when the wind blows even slightly the station goes digital. Thank goodness for Amazon Prime and Netflix.
customer_reviews.author: JW Coop

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this antenna! I picked up 40 channels! Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah (Ashlyn) Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Ehhhh
customer_reviews.text: This antenna does not reach 80 miles. It can't even reach 25, which is the nearest tower from my house. With another 5-10 towers 55 miles away and being on the second floor of my house, I have determined that this antenna doesn't work. I have given 2 stars because it is easy to put together. However it spans like 5 feet so it isn't much of an indoor antenna unless you want to dress it up as a vulture and hang it on your wall ominously watching you.
customer_reviews.author: Carson

customer_reviews.title: Put up outside directed at the Empire State Building antennas ...
customer_reviews.text: Put up outside directed at the Empire State Building antennas. 22 miles away.. Works ok with an amp attached. Get all channels but VHF are a bit weak.
customer_reviews.author: BigAlBiggyBigs

customer_reviews.title: Easy to unfold and assemble
customer_reviews.text: Easy to unfold and assemble. It was missing a washer but we just put in a similar one and it works. We actually just ended up sticking this on our old satellite dish post, hooked it up and pointed it. We live 26 miles from the towers and get crystal clear picture. The price it perfect since all the antennas in the store are like $100.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up outside only 35 miles from Chicago and only get some stations. I for more channels with a flat antenna. Would return of I didn't throw box away. Wish they would give me a refund.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic and gets the channels that my previous antenna did not.
customer_reviews.author: MDelsart

product_meta.title: ViewTV DA-290 Indoor/Outdoor Compact Yagi HDTV Antenna and Mounting Pole for Roof or Attic - 80 Miles Range
product_meta.description:
Have a television with a tuner or a digital converter box and want all of those FREE channels? This is the antenna for you! 

Receive digital and analog TV broadcast over the air
Frequency Range: VHF: 40-230MHz / UHF: 470-862MHz
Cross-phase, multi-element design
Mostly pre-assembled - only minor assembly required
Superior construction to withstand tough outdoor weather conditions
Can be mounted in attic as well 

Specifications: 

Frequency Range: VHF: 40-230MHz
UHF: 470-862MHz


Gain:
VHF: 9dB
UHF: 8dB 

Mile Range: 80 Miles 

Antenna Pole Specifications:
Made of weather resistant iron
18.5" in length from bottom to top
1" Diameter 

Pole Installation:
1. Place the mast through the mounting base of the J-pole.
2. Level up the mounting base and then mark the pilot holes to be drilled with a marking pen.
3. Drill the pilot holes (with a drill bit about half the diameter of the bolt) into the marked areas.
4. Line up the holes of the mounting base of the J-pole with the drilled holes.
5. Drill and then secure the lag bolts into the pilot holes. 

Notes:
- Go to antennaweb.org and type in your zip code. This will show you where the broadcast towers near you are located.
- If you are using an older "fat" television, you will most likely need a digital converter box to use this antenna
- ***Attaching the antenna to your television or digital converter box is only part of the process to pull in channels from your antenna. You need to perform an "automatic channel search". This is a feature that can be used by accessing the menu on your television or digital converter box. Please refer to the manual for your television or digital converter box for information on how to perform this action.***
feature_bullets: 80 Mile Range | ATSC Compatible | Receive free digital broadcast High Definition TV signals
Antenna comes mostly pre-assembled. Only minor assembly required.
Superior reception outdoors or even when mounted in the attic
Full HDTV Support: 720p, 1080i, 1080p | Frequency Range: VHF: 40-230MHz / UHF: 470-862MHz

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars88 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
